intro: Schmidelia hispida, commonly known as the hispid schmidelia, is a small, flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Schmidelia hispida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
